title: Amulet with a Stylized Figure of Heh, the God of Eternity
description:
Small silver (?) electrum pendant from a necklace. Probably a highly conventionalized version of the well-known amulet of a seated figure in a frame of the sky supported by "was" pillars. Suspension loop on reverse.
Condition: Good, metal slightly discolored.
credit_line: Gift of the Egypt Exploration Fund
section: Maintaining the Deceased in the Afterlife

museum_location.name: Funerary Gallery 3, Martha A. and Robert S. Rubin Gallery, 3rd Floor

labels.title: 13.1035, 13.1036, 13.1037
labels.content: The three metal amulets in this case are highly stylized versions of a common Middle Kingdom motif: a kneeling figure of Heh, the god of eternity, holding two hieroglyphs for “year.” These objects reflect Sa-Inher’s wish to live forever.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art
